first_reading.text:
[[Jc 4,13]]Beloved : Come now, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we shall go into such and such a town, spend a year there doing business, and make a profit"--
[[Jc 4,14]]you have no idea what your life will be like tomorrow. You are a puff of smoke that appears briefly and then disappears.
[[Jc 4,15]]Instead you should say, "If the Lord wills it, we shall live to do this or that."
[[Jc 4,16]]But now you are boasting in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil.
[[Jc 4,17]]So for one who knows the right thing to do and does not do it, it is a sin.
first_reading.title: Letter of James

gospel.text:
[[Mc 9,38]]John said to Jesus, "Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in your name, and we tried to prevent him because he does not follow us."
[[Mc 9,39]]Jesus replied, "Do not prevent him. There is no one who performs a mighty deed in my name who can at the same time speak ill of me.
[[Mc 9,40]]For whoever is not against us is for us.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

psalm.text:
[[Ps 49,2]]Hear this, all you peoples! 
Give ear, all who inhabit the world,
[[Ps 49,3]]You of lowly birth or high estate, 
rich and poor alike.

[[Ps 49,6]]Why should I fear in evil days, 
when my wicked pursuers ring me round,
[[Ps 49,7]]They trust in their wealth; 
the abundance of their riches is their boast.

[[Ps 49,8]]Yet in no way can a man redeem himself, 
or pay his own ransom to God;
[[Ps 49,9]]Too high is the price to redeem one’s life; he would never have enough
[[Ps 49,10]]to remain alive always and not see destruction.

[[Ps 49,11]]Anyone can see that the wisest die, 
the fool and the senseless pass away too, 
and must leave their wealth to others.
psalm.title: Psalms
